name: drskradley
text:
Correction: "I guess we all gotta have a hobby."

It would seem mine is editing posts obsessively. The Pat-semblance is saddening :(

name: ninjaein
text: Well spoken against the Troll. *thumbsup*

name: soticoto
text:
Where have you been?

Trolls are everywhere.
The sky is a bridge and everyone lives under it now.

name: ghede
text: Okay, now that is an awesome phrase. I shall write it down, steal it, and never credit you for it as I don't know your name. If I do credit it, it shall read "Person who wrote something neat on the internet."

name: soticoto
text:
I only go by the name shown here.
I'm the one and only SotiCoto.

Google it... and you will find places I've been, people who have spoken about me, and people who have satirised me.
Any other name is unimportant.

name: jlynes
text: I have to agree with ghede.  That is one hell of evocative turn of phrase.

name: soticoto
text:
Why thank you... whoever you are.
Who are you anyway?

name: jlynes
text: I...  I don't really know.

name: deusoma
text: Apparently your identity crisis is chubbifiable. This intrigues me.

name: thescrivener
text: Not as much as the word 'chubbifiable' intrigues me.

name: gunsofray
text: chibbied for . . for.. being.. that which is nobody else. How did you some up with it?

name: onepapertiger
text: soticoto you remind me of a better-phrased version of the plastic bag kid from the movie I never saw, American Beauty. Props, dude.

name: soticoto
text: That is the nicest thing anyone has ever said about me on assetbar. I just shed a single tear.

name: lacrimus
text: You'd better believe Phillipe has wicked sack.

name: contrasoma
text:
I just realised that the faces Phillipe makes in panels four, six and seven show how innocent and corruptible he is:

Panel 4: Naive amazement at the novelty of hearing cussing.

Panel 5: Identification with the noble rage and catharsis that comes with cussing.

Panel 7: Now a seasoned connoisseur of cusses, Phillipe knows cussing as epic as T's when he hears it, and responds with appropriate acknowledgment of its brutality.

name: drskradley
text:
And finally, Panel 9: Return to normal Phillipe sanguine-type personality - now with added acceptance of the cussing as new and integrated into general conversation and exploring of the world.

Innocent and corruptible, indeed.

And a chubby for the high degree of "fucking amazing" that is your avatar. One of the great books.

name: contrasoma
text:
The cycle is complete. With Lie-Bot and Lyle around, I really dread to think of all of the various social taboos that have been normalized for our little otter via this algorithm.

...And thanks! The amount of love (or at least recognition) this avatar's received in a couple of weeks here severely outweighs that which it's garnered anywhere else for the past three or four years that I've been using it. Achewood fans are a classy and well-read bunch, but we all already knew that...

name: retinarow
text: It may be a little bit awkward to respond to a comment about love of someone's icon only to say that I also love your icon, but I also love your icon. One of my favorite novels.

name: grantasaurus
text: What novel is that? I'm not familiar. I'm such a philistine.

name: rowboat
text: I will deign to answer that question ('cause I had to look it up, too). The Crying of Lot 49 by Thomas Pynchon. I feel bad for never having read him. I was in a band called The Whole Sick Crew and I never even got around to reading V. Guess I should spend less time doing things like this.

name: billylk
text: We Await Silent Tristero's Empire

name: tekende
text: We're All So Terribly Excited.

name: tatterdemalion
text: I am commenting from THE FUTURE to tell you I also love your avatar.  Also, have you noticed how totally influenced Gibson's 'Pattern Recognition' is by Crying?

name: lhmatt
text: he's merely just mimicing teodor.

name: whuppins
text:
I thought he was reacting to the harsh dissing of Mr. Tomino.

You know, like in a "oh no you di'int" kind of way.

name: jerkface
text: Phillipe does have a little huge sassy black lady in him. Don't we all...

name: rowboat
text: Panel 6 - imaginary phone. Panel 7 - imaginary cusses.

name: peterjoel
text: I saw panel 6 as punching air in support of Teodor's stand, and panel 7 as wincing at the severity of Teodor's assault.

name: lateadopter
text:
Panel 6: Checking watch, annoyed at Teodor for making him wait to eat candy.
Panel 7: Squinched up face over nasty things T says.

name: lateadopter
text: Lamed by nbgreene again.  That guy must really not enjoy the content of my messages.

name: boredom_man
text: Dude. You notice who lames you?

name: lateadopter
text: I am more bored than you.  Also, I modify my behavior if I get lamed by someone I respect.

name: drskradley
text:
The dude cold takes it serious .

It's amazing how seemingly arbitrary chubbies and lames can hugely affect one's forum-based actions. It's good...and kinda disturbing. Like a test version for a meritocratic society. And also kinda stupid.

name: lateadopter

name: biff
text:
Wouldn't there be motion lines nest to Philippe's had if he were punching the air? Like the motion lines which indicate Teodor quivering with rage?

No lines = No motion = No punching air

No motion = Philippe imitating the behaviors of the adult he is currently admiring.

Rowboat has got this one figured out.

name: biff
text:
Crap.

Motion lines neXt to Philippe's haNd .

Crsp.

name: coldfrog
text: Captain haddock is the reason I can't grow a beard any more.  I've become deathly afraid of setting it on fire or getting it caught in things or even whether I should sleep with it over or under the blankets.

name: honesttom
text: Ah, Captain Haddock. I long for a return to the days when the main supporting character in a children's book could be a sweary middle-aged drunk.

name: jackparsons

name: wae
text: ugh - assetbar moved me. (comment was in re: "Phillipe does have a little huge sassy black lady in him. Don't we all...")

name: norrin
text:
The first time I saw it I thought he was checking his watch on panel 6, thinking the phone call was dragging on. This is probably wrong as he has no watch and probably can't tell time anyway.

I then decided that was him getting a peice of gum or candy from his stash and then panel 7 was his chewing.

name: mattfish
text: I'm pretty sure he's mimicking Teodor's posture in panels 6 and 7, so Rowboat's pretty much right

name: spinynorman
text:
The name "Tomino" just sounds like it has 70% more douche than most other douches.

I see this guy being the sort of person who makes slang out of everyday words by cutting them in half. Like, "The communication obstacle constitutes a grave threat for our business. We need to reimagine our goals to produce more gain," he'd say, "The comms obst really brings primo heat on the HQ. The const factor is no good, my man. Gotta reimadge what we're shooting at and pump up the prod situaish, right, ese?" and then he'd offer a fist bump.

You'd decline.

You would so decline.

name: spinynorman
text: Trust the Tomster, brah.

name: tekende
text: Yes. He would be exactly like that douchebag realtor in I Love You, Man .

name: aliiis
text: Yes, I read it as that only I pronounced it "*sucking in air between your front teeth sound*, BUUUUURRRRRRRRNNNNN", which is the British way.

text: Indeed.  Were it not for John Tomino, it's almost inconceivable that we'd ever have seen such landmark turds as Rance Janicek or Perry Appleton.

text:
Perry Appleton? No Way! Dude's all show.

but I love the WASTE. Dr. Hilarius, is that you?

name: contrasoma
text:
While his early work might've relied too heavily on smoke and mirrors, I feel that there are some subtle but truly astonishing experiments with form and technique in the later portion of his oeuvre () that were overshadowed due, as you say, to his previous showiness.

...And nope, I'm not Dr. Hilarious. I did, however, audition unsuccessfully to play bass in the Paranoids.

name: contrasoma
text: Oops.  Those parentheses should've contained some of the examples I was referring to: "Soap Ice Cream" and "Triple Divorce Over Christmas Break In Mauve," specifically.

name: nullzero
text: I hear he also owns a grocery store in Pittsburgh, or so saith Google

name: drskradley
text:
Yeah, I saw that, but decided to not post it, as I'm guessing it's not the same guy*, and should thus not receive any undue comeuppance from, potentially, the one rabidly crazy Acheworldian. I mean, this guy might be a turd, too, but perhaps not the seminal turd of which we are concerned.

*That's if Onstad didn't use a fake name - which would be unlike him given his known proficiency in creating the most awesome of fake names (see Great Outdoor Fight) - however, I would assume the possibility that he used the dude's real name to be higher, given that he actually got one of these on All Hallo's Eve, and it was actually enraging toward him.

name: tekende
text: You're operating on the unproven assumption that the alt text is true, though.

text: Excellent, but it requires more springing. I propose adding something about a seminal turd springing from the piss fountain. It would be the scariest for a seminal turd to come into being.

John At Tom: "I know reality."

... OOOOOOOOOH!

name: lordhumungus

name: hayzeus
text:
Other places that will contain adverts, blurbs, logos and similar marketing devices in the near future:

-Tattoos
-Tree Barks
-The surface of The Moon
-Legal Tender
-Cigarette Papers
-Seeing-Eye Dogs
-Eulogies
-Shaved into the back of people's heads
-National Flags
-Medical Charts
-The Great Wall Of China
-The hats of Mall Santas
-Paris Hilton's labia

Advertising is a plague that none of us will ever be safe from.

This comment was brought to you by Friedman's Fries: the golden crust make Friedman's Fries a must. Friedman's Fires: don't be an arsehole- eat some chips.

name: spectre
text: And the inside of yur eyelids . . . but you can "opt out" (for a fee).

name: ninjaein
text:
Aw...I'm all outta chubbies to give...

"Paris Hilton's labia"... Hehe! Nice one.

name: paco
text: I don't know about the others, but I've read of people getting paid to have adds tattooed to them. Apparently some people even make a living wage in this way.

name: hcaz
text:
Yeah, in Vice the other month or whatever, there were those pictures of those kids hanging out at the beach, and some company like Lost or something had gone down there with some stencils and some paint and stencilled these kids up, "Hi! I'm some twelve year old girl, look at my sweet stencil! Yeah, I know! I let some sleazy mid-twenty year old halfway down my pants so he could spray this shit on. Hold on, I think that's enough of you talking to me, the people at the company said that I should be careful who I'm seen in public with."

It would have been nice to see T down there getting his rage on - instead it was some photographer taking beautiful photos of these stupid kids.

name: phy
text:
Advertising on police cars
And your death will sell you out

name: _cheesekayke
text: 2 of those things (tattoos and shaving) have already happened. I just want to know the exact wording of that marketing pitch. "Whereas other, outdaded advertisers try to convince people that famous and/or sexy people use their product, we will convince the public to buy our shit by showing that it is a favorite of lunatics who shave billboards into their own heads. Because everyone aspires to be that guy."

name: hayzeus
text:
And it's not going to stop there. Not by the longest of so many shots. A few more places soon to used for advertising purposes:

- The Leaning Tower of Pisa
- Stripper's breasts
- War Memorial Poppies
- Airplane Sick Bags
- The bottom of whiskey bottles ('Jack says one more
won't kill ya!')
- Picket signs at Anti-Death Penalty marches
- Nobel Prize acceptance speeches
- Ecstasy tablets
-The Samaritan's Suicide Hotline.
-The Popemobile
-The middle names of an entire generation.

I could do this forever. The waters of cynicism are warm. Come bathe with us.

name: lateadopter
text: You could have started and stopped with Paris Hilton's labia.  The notion that what should be hidden is now appealing as advertising space, and only as that, is what was funny.

name: ninjaein
text: What about those little bland Valentine hearts?

name: skoora
text: If Onstad really did get three of those then God is dead and there is no innocence left in the world.

name: youfailme
text: This is the funniest comment I have ever seen.

name: stormagnet
text: Advertising really has invaded medical charts. I had to hand-carry some recently, and there was pharmaceutical company crap all over them.

name: norm
text:
T can, in fact, talk dirty with the dirtiest dudes in town.

p.s.

I'm not going to be one of the hundreds (perhaps thousands) of people who fuck up a link to a previous Achewood. January 10th, 2002.

name: clembot
text: just man up and put the link next time

name: hyetal
text:
Come on, people, BBcode isn't that hard. All it takes is ten seconds to read over what you've written... but I guess that's asking a lot from Internet folks.

Here, I'll do it.

http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua1Cgw9k

name: prine
text: I would've chubbied the hell out of you if you'd deliberately screwed that link up

name: drskradley
text: I love that the recent spate of BBcode cock-ups has resulted in a generational and growing fear of BBcode in general, to the point that we are increasingly side-stepping it, quivering at the thought of the resulting embarrassment of the cock-up. Curiouser still, given the fact that such screw-ups only result in hilarity, chubbies, and indirect threats of knifing from a sock puppet anthropomorphic manifestation of the AssetBar itself. This would surely be reason to keep on screwing it up.

name: lateadopter
text:
When I was introduced to computers and e-mail, I was told it was rude to comment on other people's typos. I think the same goes double for BBCode.

Did you know that certain characters get stripped out of your BBCode when you post a comment to AssetBar, so proofreading doesn't fix everything? For example, if a URL contains a search string, the plus signs don't get through.

name: drskradley
text: Well if THAT ain't the suckinest.  Also, I was reared by a secretary growing up, so I have this intrinsic desire to have perfect spelling everywhere.  Thankfully, be it through her or myself, I have also learned to not be an utter douche about it toward other people.  Just as you know from your introduction to it, such a knowledge is important to follow.

name: woodenteeth
text: What I want is this Assetbar to get so utterly self-reflexive that we all end up posting panels for the comic and Onstad just starts typing up same-page BBcode links to the panels in the comments below it (and now I don't care if the latter is possible).

name: lateadopter
text: Your wish is granted .

name: lateadopter
text: Sorry, that was not your wish.  But the link works.  Fuck.

name: boyvirgil
text: thank you! geez!

name: youfailme
text:
It seems pretty ridiculous to me that ANYONE can mess up BBcode since it's like the simplest shit ever.

My favorite Achewood strip

See?

name: norrin
text: Simple things are easy to screw up. They require only simple mistakes.

name: coldfrog
text: Alternate outcome: Teodor does not check the candy; tomorrow Phillipe buys property.

name: dayvancowboy
text: I'd like to think estate agents wouldn't sell a house to a five year old otter, but then I liked to think there would be no sequels to Final Destination , but there were, so I fear you might be right.

text:
Ray once sold nearly $1600 of software to a five year old otter.

Man'd up and posted a link

name: excusemesenator
text: Well the way Ray hands out money you never know what could happen. In fact, I'd like to see that!

name: jordstar
text: The alt text makes me wonder what kind of special hell the housing market is going through in the general Achewood area.

name: lawbot
text: Teodor is hardcore now.

name: boscostacy
text: Teodor has been talking dirty forever. The only difference is that now, he's concerned about doing it in front of the youth, while he used to consider it good entertainment for Little Nephew's birthday party.

name: lawbot
text:
I believe you've misunderstood the meaning of the word "now."

Take the time to review his performance over the last couple of weeks, and you'll see what I mean.

name: boscostacy
text: Good point. But still, he is hardcore once again. Because he was most certainly hardcore before. T-bag is merely returning to the halls of the hardcore.

name: coolbreeze3
text: So many curses, so little time. Rock on T, rock on. Also, Philippe's faces in panels 6 and 7 are the best.

name: balvo
text: Agreed. Philippe's expression in panel 6 is priceless. Tiny fin curled up in indignant rage is a perfect mimicry of Teodor's rant. Monkey see, monkey do.

name: prine
text: I'm partial to Phillipe's subsequent cringe at the righteous verbal smackdown the poor dude on the phone is receiving. On the other end of that phone a guy is recoiling as though struck in the face. Teodor has the motherfucking Voice.

name: lahnnabell
text:
Panel 1, Phillipe holding out his bag to T from that angle is so cute.
Is that a righteous otter flipper-fist I see in panel 6?! Amazing.

T's anger over this is so potent too. Who knew that real estate advertisement warranted the same level of action as razorblades stuck in an apple?
Last, but not least, Mr. Wizard FTW!

name: tommyd
text: The otter hand is a complex appendage. A paw with both webbing and claws. I don't know if you could call it a flipper, though. You may be confusing Philippe's hand with the Incan God of neck-ties.

name: lahnnabell
text: Comments on earlier posts have referred to it as a flipper, so that is why I referred to it as such.  True, otters rather have paws though.  For grippin' and crackin' those shells open.  Still a-freakin-dorable!

name: whuppins
text: (HUGE cusses)

name: rowboat
text: Dr. Philippe's first huge cuss. I expect to hear about this if I'm wrong.

text: Phillipe didst inquire about the C-word last Friday Facts.  That was epic indeed.

name: rowboat
text: Ah, yes. First one spoken, maybe?

name: helpingfriendlybook
text: dirtiest dudes

"HOLY JESUS CHRIST, IS THERE A BUSINESS CARD TAPED TO THIS FUCKING CANDY?!"

Best... retorical... question... ever. Even better than "It´s that your bitch? The ugly one?"

name: boscostacy
text: T-dor does not only talk dirty, he talks redundantly. See also: "I want you to wake up to the fact that you have turned a children's holiday into an ad for your fucking real estate company." I believe that John Tomino already knows this. Theoneyouwant can ask him about it at work tomorrow.

name: i_love_kate

text: You know I'm forced to wonder... has anybody ever actually SEEN a doctor wear one of those things on their heads?

name: norrin
text: I think they've become antiquated. I think they were probably legit like 30 years ago,

name: gobacktostereo
text:
I actually asked my doctor to start wearing one of those once.

She is not a happy lady.

name: biff
text: More like 50 years ago.  I know this because I can remember going to the doctor in the 60s, and I have never seen one.

name: bovine
text: A comment left by bovine was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, rowboat, Boredom_Man, nathanielperson)

name: bovine
text: A comment left by bovine was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, rowboat, Boredom_Man, nathanielperson)

name: biff
text:
Depends on which you are talking about, the Best Before expiration date or the Discard After expiration date.

I would say I still have a couple of days left before reaching the former, and at least several months before the latter.

name: bovine
text: insist that no throw you out when you reach one of those, citing that 'I'm still good you can't even smell anything.'

name: ttagxamm
text: Cecil of the Straight Dope knows all.

name: lateadopter
text: I have seen doctors wearing the little mirror.  Nowadays, though, the equivalent is an LED flashlight strapped to the forehead, with a battery pack at the waist.

name: drskradley
text: Yeah, but if you wore that on Halloween as part of a doctor's outfit, people'd be like "Oh isn't that cutest little costume that otter has on!  A scientist/spelunker!"

name: drskradley
text: Alternatively, a speleologist . Thank you Wikipedia.

name: gussiejives
text: Yeah, definitely an anachronism now.

name: norrin
text:
I Googled "John Tomino" to see if he was a real realtor. The search lead me to this:

#4) Mr. and Mrs. John Tomino, 751 Walnut Street, Lockport, New York 14094. Solicits people to commit acts of violence against innocent veterans via a parabolic microphone in their home aimed at the relatives of veterans who haven%u2019t committed any crimes.

name: tekende
text:
W...

h...

I think that might be the most awesome thing I've ever heard of, but I'm not sure.

I gotta go take stock.

name: tekende
text: Okay guys, what Norrin is talking about links to this page . I don't know what the hell it is, but it seems to have been put together by a crazy person and there is some really funny shit in there, like a guy who wrote a story for a college class and then claimed that it was stolen from him and made into a movie starring Terry Farrell and David Hasselhoff.

name: gournal
text:
I just spent so much time reading that website. It was worth it though for:

"83) The following Hollywood actors conspire against and torture honorably discharged soldiers who have not committed any crimes in exchange for money to support their cocaine habit:
The actor who played Jody Foster's FBI boss in The Silence of the Lambs.
The actor who played an African American Starfleet Officer in Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan and had a bug stuck in his ear by Khan.
Jeri Ryan.
Kevin Nealon

name: gournal
text:
Also, I just invented a great game to play on that website.
Your mission is to find the ONE person/group out of the 100 something he has listed, who he specifically says "did not do cocaine." The prize is... well I guess all I have to give is one chubby, but there's also a lot of glory involved because this is on the internet.

name: pyromancer
text: Some years back during a mechanical frustration in the drive, I flouted in a similar fashion.  Spent, I looked up to discover my sainted mother had wandered by and heard all the flouting. I hated that.

name: lemoncakes
text: I received a bag of candy saying that jesus loved me and that I was invited to sunday school to a lutheran church. inside was one tootsie roll.

name: bovine
text: jesus' love isn't infinite apparently.

name: heeeraldo
text: sadly, neither are my chubbies.

name: biff
text: Yeah,'cause if you had infinite chubbies the girls would never let you out of bed.

name: loneal
text: It is okay, it happens to everyone.

name: drskradley
text: I've got some ointment for that.

name: tombsgrave
text: Three these-es, three wished buckets of Gypsy shit.  Good times.

name: jar
text: Don't worry Téodor, there's no way your flouting could be worse than that.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: the last panel causes me to pray to all that is considered holy that Phillipe doesn't begin to cuss. i don't think Onstad would let that happen but i've been wrong before. (Exhibit A, The Colorado Rockies.)

name: cpnglxynchos
text: oh, and to Torino's credit..it is a whole Hershey bar instead of the silly 'fun' sized ones.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: *Tomino. f-..f-..frick.

name: tetsujin
text:
"oh, and to Torino's credit..it is a whole Hershey bar instead of the silly 'fun' sized ones."

Well, you can't tape a business card to the back of a "fun-size" candy bar... It changes the whole relationship from "candy with a card attached" to "card with candy attached"...

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hah. good point.

name: tetsujin
text:
(Exhibit A: The Colorado Rockies)

Sweep! Whoo!

name: madnes
text: I think Teodor went as Bill Hicks, this Halloween.

name: woodenteeth
text: Chubbies (I'm out for this page). Yes, Assetbar, I am Friendly. Don't use that tone with me.

name: dovey
text: Seconded. AssetBar is a jealous mistress

name: ford
text: how did i miss this comment?

name: woodenteeth
text: Every now and then Phillipe actually comes across as a bit of a "Rain Man" character rather than a 5 year old.

name: biff
text: That is inevitable when you are five for years on end.

name: mikeleffel2
text: Jeepers, Nice Pete got off scott free from Teodor's Sailor Mouth, and he kidnapped the li'l guy!

name: chuvak
text: No, he took him to get ice cream.

name: orf
text: That's because Nice Pete drowns people who sass him in ponds.  Mr Tomino just saddles such people with disadvantageous mortgages.

name: biff
text: I would NEVER sass Nice Pete in a pond.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: oh how you would thrash in the cold cold water...

name: irreverend
text: This is amazing.

name: professorhazard
text: No One Can Stop Mr. Tomino!

name: bloopher
text: Phillipe's doctor costume is rather lackluster.  He needs a stethoscope.

name: andyetandyet
text:
ALERT ALERT
2007 weblog awards comic category nominations do not include achewood but do include a bunch of other bullshit.
achewood fanbase please commence burning the motherfucker down.

name: chuvak
text:
Suggested comment to leave in forum/guestbook/whatever:
"Where in the gay is achewood?"
It would be nice if we could all leave one uniform comment.

name: midget_jones
text: Oh my god I think I just came.

name: norrin
text: If you're not %100 certain then you didn't.

name: cailetshadow
text: Tell that to the child you just sired.

name: norrin
text: Frowntown. Population: me and my new bastard child.

name: versacesmux
text: God Bless you Mister Wizard :)

name: cpnglxynchos
text: what's up, original bubs?

name: rhadamanthus
text: I sincerely hope that Philippe never finds out about jenkem.

name: vandenbos
text: Great strip, but now I am bummed out because I have been reminded that Don "Mr. Wizard" Herbert died this Summer :(

name: dirtyantaeus
text: Mister Onstad there is something with you and full-size bars and halloween. http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuag1bgHQ

name: i_love_kate
text: I guess stuffed animals and humans have different standards for "full-size" candy bars. By human standards that thing's barely fun sized.

name: steerpike66
text: No Teodor, laying the smack down on realtor scum is not bad parenting. You are a sword of righteousness.

name: dybrar
text: There is indeed a time and a place for HUGE cusses.

name: niraj
text: This comic is easily one of my favorites

name: xiaomimi
text:

-Ray-
Beef's Bachelor Party - HARD PLANS.
At the Hotel in Sydney!

name: i_love_kate
text: What is terrifying about Marmold is that the clerk doesn't claim to make it himself, just to "collect and package" it.

name: otterpops
text: THAT is why Hillary Clinton's appearance on Sesame Street in the mid 90s was so wrong.

name: lolsworth
text: It makes him so pissed off he just instantaneously dials the number and gives him the 555-1212 without even considering that Philippe is still in earshot.

name: jaldor
text: Personally, I'd like the think that Phillipe is dressed as Dr. Benway.

name: fictions
text: Is anyone else thinking Full Metal Jacket? Panel 3 especially.

name: yaotzin
text: This gets a five for me, because it really captures exactly how I would feel if I found an advertisement on a bar of candy during halloween.
